meanings.definition: A person who instructs others in the principles of a religion through catechism.
meanings.sent1: The catechizers at the church taught the children about their faith.
meanings.sent2: The catechizers in the community play an important role in religious education.
meanings.sent3: The catechizers decided to have a quiz on the catechism to make learning more fun.
meanings.sent4: The catechizers were like guiding stars, leading the congregation on the path of belief.
meanings.sent5: The image of the catechizers patiently explaining the catechism stayed with the students.

meanings.definition: The act of instructing others in the principles of a religion through catechism.
meanings.sent1: Learning from the catechizers helped the students understand their faith better.
meanings.sent2: The catechizers' dedication to catechism instruction was commendable.
meanings.sent3: The room was filled with laughter as the catechizers acted out scenes from the catechism.
meanings.sent4: The power of the catechizers' words resonated deeply with the congregation.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere in the class was vibrant with the enthusiasm of the catechizers.
